stepTitle: These are the coordinates for L1 and L2, (44, $$80.5)$$, (35, $$70.5)$$, $$(20.4$$, 57), $$(33,66)$$, $$(31,68)$$, $$(35,72)$$, $$(18.5$$, 52), (37, $$73.5)$$, $$(26,53)$$ Given data of input and corresponding outputs from a linear function, first find the best fit line using linear regression. Enter the input(x coordinate) in List $$1$$ (L1). Enter the output(y coordinate) in List $$2$$ (L2). On a graphing utility, select Linear Regression (LinReg). After solving the best fit line, solve for the temperature if there are $$30$$ chirps. (Round to the nearest tenths) The $$x$$ represents the chirps and $$y$$ represents the temperature.
